message_1: Suppose you are conducting an experiment to test the effects of a new fertilizer on the growth of tomato plants. You have 20 tomato plants, and you want to divide them equally into two groups: a control group that will not receive the fertilizer, and a treatment group that will receive the fertilizer. How many tomato plants should be assigned to the treatment group and how many to the control group?
message_2: To divide the 20 tomato plants equally into two groups, you should assign 10 tomato plants to the treatment group (which will receive the fertilizer) and 10 tomato plants to the control group (which will not receive the fertilizer).
